flop.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to sit or lie down in a relaxed way, by letting all your weight fall heavily onto a chair etc
flop.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: He flopped down onto the bed.
I got home and flopped in front of the TV.
flop.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to hang or fall loosely, in an uncontrolled way
flop.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if something such as a product, play, or idea flops, it is not successful because people do not like it
flop.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a film, play, product etc that is not successful
flop.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The film was a complete flop.
flop.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: the movement or noise that something makes when it falls heavily
flop.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: He fell with a flop into the water.
flop.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: if a product or an attempt to do something flops, it fails completely
flop.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: A £16 million rights issue in the company flopped yesterday with only 2.4 % of the 151 million shares on offer taken up.
Some members of the board pointed out that many of sales director’s schemes have flopped.
